rules: Rule1: If raw material A is compliant with the quality check, then batch X has manufacturing approval per FDA standards.
Rule2: Either raw material A is compliant with the quality check or raw material B is compliant with the quality check.
Rule3: Either batch X has production approval in facility 1, or if raw material B is compliant with the quality check, then batch X has manufacturing approval per FDA standards.
Rule4: Whenever mixing tank 3 is available during the production shift, it is not the case that batch X has production approval in facility 1.
Rule5: Sterilizer 2 is available during the production shift or mixing tank 3 is available during the production shift.
Rule6: Under the condition that facility 1 passed the safety audit for the Q3 period, batch X does not have production approval in facility 1.
Rule7: If facility 1 has completed the safety inspection in the weekly check, then facility 1 passed the safety audit for the Q3 period.
facts: Fact1: Facility 1 has completed the safety inspection in the weekly check.
Fact2: It is not the case that sterilizer 2 is available during the production shift.

question: Batch X has manufacturing approval per FDA standards.
